memberdef.name: helptitle_atomname
memberdef.initializer: = "Selecting atoms by name"

briefdescription.para: Help title for atom name selection keywords.

memberdef.name: help_atomname
memberdef.initializer:
= { "::", "", " name", " pdbname", " atomname", " pdbatomname", "", "These keywords select atoms by name. [TT]name[tt] selects atoms using", "the GROMACS atom naming convention.", "For input formats other than PDB, the atom names are matched exactly", "as they appear in the input file. For PDB files, 4 character atom names", "that start with a digit are matched after moving the digit to the end", "(e.g., to match 3HG2 from a PDB file, use [TT]name HG23[tt]).", "[TT]pdbname[tt] can only be used with a PDB input file, and selects", "atoms based on the exact name given in the input file, without the", "transformation described above.[PAR]",
"[TT]atomname[tt] and [TT]pdbatomname[tt] are synonyms for the above two", "keywords." }

briefdescription.para: Help text for atom name selection keywords.

memberdef.name: helptitle_resindex
memberdef.initializer: = "Selecting atoms by residue number"

briefdescription.para: Help title for residue index selection keywords.

memberdef.name: help_resindex
memberdef.initializer: = { "::", "", " resnr", " resid", " resindex", " residue", "", "[TT]resnr[tt] selects atoms using the residue numbering in the input", "file. [TT]resid[tt] is synonym for this keyword for VMD compatibility.", "", "[TT]resindex N[tt] selects the [TT]N[tt]th residue starting from the", "beginning of the input file. This is useful for uniquely identifying", "residues if there are duplicate numbers in the input file (e.g., in", "multiple chains).", "[TT]residue[tt] is a synonym for [TT]resindex[tt]. This allows", "[TT]same residue as[tt] to work as expected." }

briefdescription.para: Help text for residue index selection keywords.

memberdef.name: sm_all
memberdef.initializer: = { "all", GROUP_VALUE, 0, 0, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, &evaluate_all, NULL, }

briefdescription.para: Selection method data for all selection keyword.

briefdescription.para: Selection method data for resnr selection keyword.

memberdef.initializer: = { "resindex", INT_VALUE, 1 , 0, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, &evaluate_resindex, NULL, {NULL, helptitle_resindex, ((int)(sizeof( help_resindex )/sizeof(( help_resindex )[0]))), help_resindex} }

briefdescription.para: Selection method data for z selection keyword.
Evaluates the all selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Copies g to out->u.g.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the none selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns an empty out->u.g.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the atomnr selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the indices for each atom in out->u.i.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the resnr selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the residue numbers for each atom in out->u.i.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the resindex selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the residue indices for each atom in out->u.i.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether molecule information is present in the topology.

detaileddescription.para:
top
Topology structure.
npar
Not used.
param
Not used.
data
Not used.
0 if molecule info is present in the topology, -1 otherwise. If molecule information is not found, also prints an error message.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the molindex selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the molecule indices for each atom in out->u.i.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the atomname selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the atom name for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the pdbatomname selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the PDB atom name for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether atom types are present in the topology.

detaileddescription.para:
top
Topology structure.
npar
Not used.
param
Not used.
data
Not used.
0 if atom types are present in the topology, -1 otherwise. If the atom types are not found, also prints an error message.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the atomtype selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the atom type for each atom in out->u.s. Segfaults if atom types are not found in the topology.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the insertcode selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the insertion code for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the chain selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the chain for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the mass selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the mass for each atom in out->u.r.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the charge selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the charge for each atom in out->u.r.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether PDB info is present in the topology.

detaileddescription.para:
top
Topology structure.
npar
Not used.
param
Not used.
data
Not used.
0 if PDB info is present in the topology, -1 otherwise. If PDB info is not found, also prints an error message.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the altloc selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the alternate location identifier for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the occupancy selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the occupancy numbers for each atom in out->u.r. Segfaults if PDB info is not found in the topology.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the betafactor selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the B-factors for each atom in out->u.r. Segfaults if PDB info is not found in the topology.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the resname selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the residue name for each atom in out->u.s.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the x selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc_pos() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the x coordinate for each position in out->u.r.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the y selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the y coordinate for each position in out->u.r.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the z selection keyword.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data is not used.
Returns the z coordinate for each position in out->u.r.

briefdescription.para: Internal utility function for position keyword evaluation.

detaileddescription.para:
out
Output array.
pos
Position data to use instead of atomic coordinates.
d
Coordinate index to evaluate (XX, YY or ZZ).
This function is used internally by evaluate_x(), evaluate_y() and evaluate_z() to do the actual evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Implements simple keyword selection methods.
